comments.body: Definitely would like stronger scaffolding!
Maybe you could surround a scaffold in the crafting table with 4 iron ingotd
I love the faster travel and decorative uses. This should be absolutely implemented

Was thinking this is a perfect idea considering the new villagers added in 1.14. Add a builder class villager and the architecture block to make a builder the same way a fisherman or armourer get created when they find a barrel or blast furnace. I'm guessing this is inspired by the structure block that map makers have available to them.

I'd image having the item (blueprint) that when placed down creates a construction site (marked with a sign on the ground) based on the blueprint. This construction site will have a visible bounding box based on the width and height of the saved structure. If the bounding box intersects with any block, construction will be halted. The player has to basically make a clear construction site for the builder to keep working. Id also imagine that the builder will go near the construction site (probably just outside the bounding box) and blocks will get filled in periodically. The builder could be leveled up like other villagers and the higher the level the faster they build.
Sounds good.

Another idea could be to introduce the hammer as a new tool: from the architecture table you can see which materials (and how many) are required for the structure you want to build; by going to the site with the hammer and materials you can simply hit a single block of the new structure for it to be built; the idea is that a diamond hammer can build faster than a rock hammer. (also a builder (villager)  at master level could build faster than a builder at apprendice level)


Another idea is to add a map to the architecture table GUI and with that select the area where to build the building, or just where you can see where new buildings will be built (the idea of Alberto Olivia of costruction site is also good).

I found very interesting the idea of implementing it as a job for villagers.

We should have the ability to create a blueprint in creative mode.  This could work in several ways.

Lay the makers for a building design to determine the dimensions and resources needed to reproduce that structure.  Blueprints could cost XP to use, depending on the size and quality of resources used to make a structure. Blueprints could only be used if the player had the resources in inventory or in a nearby chest. This could help save time rebuilding the same structure multiple times, and allow for creative players to show off their creations.  Blueprints could then be added similarly to skins, and be made available for purchase through the store.  

Blueprints should list the materials used in construction and how much flat area is required to build the structure. Blueprints would be for the construction blocks only and not include torches, beds, construction tables, etc.
amazing wand that will make the sticks in mine craft fun
No!!! it will make minecraft stupid game...
I think that a bit of magic would make my day in minecraft! Mojang should totally add magic wands to Minecraft!!

Love this idea but would need to make wands difficult to obtain. I'm thinking mob head included in construction with mob head appearing at the end of wand tip. Mob heads could give different effects depending which is used. Creeper head gives explosion effect. Also wands should cost XP to use as magic/mana source. I think with mob head and XP combo for wands they could be very powerful but would keep balance on usage and creation.

Casting spells should cost experience, that way you keep the game balanced and only find it more useful in endgame where you've gotten all the enchantments you want and have nothing better to do with xp

I feel like wouldn’t be able to craft a wand more like find it or earn it from a cleric or wizard some how or forge it from a jewel. Also wouldn’t it be better to have spell books added that the player has to add in order to learn new spells. And if wands are added I feel like soccers and sorceresses should be added as well as mini bosses.

Instead of listing out all the options like this (it's pretty obvious that it would be mobs, weapons, and easter egg items like the Mojang logo), it would likely be more effective to discuss how this would actually look.

For example, would this be a menu that pops up?

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.

It would be easier to just make it so the composter gives its own item. It can work just like bone meal but cant make white dye and can only be used to grow plants. Good idea though, I'll vote.
Bone meal IS fertilizer in Minecraft. There is no need for an item that does the exact same thing as bone meal. What i would prefer is if composters produced dirt instead.
It could look like this, like super fertilizer on the education edition but with a podzol-y texture instead of being white

Fertilizer and bone meal should have some differences fertilizer should replenish the soil after multiple uses the soil should grow crops slower and fertilizer would replenish the soil making the dirt look more brown. While bone meal should do what it is already doing.
Yes, compost is supposed to speed up plant growth. Bone meal - too, but after a while, because it is more slowly absorbed by the soil in life.

What if, instead of an "air" block, it was an invisible item frame which emitted light. It could be placed on the top, sides, or bottom of a block, Allowing the user to place it to illuminate an area without seeing the block itself, it would have a smaller hit box too.

But how would it be crafted? or accessed by the player, in survival?

What would the recipe be, or what would it be made from? Or are you proposing it only be in creative?

This could also be applied to Sand and Gravel.  However, those would be more resistant and require more effort to be triggered.  Sand more than snow, and gravel more than sand.  (Maybe soul sand in there too somewhere?  Probably between sand and gravel)

Maybe this could be done with creeper mob heads. Since almost much nothing in the game attacks creepers, rightfully so. A creeper head with maybe zombie flesh creates a creeper disguise that gives the player the same passive mob abilities as a creeper. Could be as simple as just a creeper mask. This gear should have no armor value since the point of it is to avoid combat.
It's right, but you don't explain how to make it, how to craft it.
Wearing a zombie head already has this function. Realistically, "armor" made of rotten flesh would be disgusting and absolutely useless. No support from me, sorry.
